caption: This spot never fails to impress. They have awesome dishes for affordable pricing, there no long wait even when they are busy.
Certainly a spot worth stopping over, the food is awesome and fresh, the costs are convenient and it is always well organized there. Keep it up.
Fantastic food, helpful employees, regularly excellent character. They charge reasonable rates and the food quality is excellent. Keep it up.
The food is consistently fresh and flavorful, staff members gives good service. I really like how neat it is and mood. I highly recommend this place.
Would absolutely recommend trying this place. Exceptional vibes, flavorful dishes, great service. Kudos.
The service is constantly swift, fantastic character, super nice staff members. Will visit again when I get in the area.
Would definitely recommend trying out this place. Fantastic atmosphere, fresh dishes, fantastic service. Keep up the good work.
5 stars reviews are most definitely fake, this place is really bad.
Dont come to this place if you craving for a good ramen. All edamame and corns were hard as rock and uncooked! Just a little meat that would dissapear as soon as you start eating!

Yesterday was our first time we went to this place. But It is no doubt not the last time. We enjoyed the evening very much with the courteous service, with the high quality  food and wine and with the comfortable cost. We will definitely return there soon.
Had a good experience here with my friend. The food arrived quick and the customer service is just awesome. Prices are reasonable.
The place serves big dishes and for affordable prices. friendly staff. Keep it up.

two days ago was the first time in this excellent restaurant. But It is definitely not the last. We passed a splendid evening with the efficient service, with the first-rate  food and fine drinks and with the honest payment. We will absolutely visit there in a short time.
Better choices exist, nothing special, small sizes, lacking the typical textures.

Ramen noodles seems to have been replaced with soba noodles or something similar. Maybe they expect people to not notice since soba is not very popular here, but it doesn't complement the broth very well. Cute place,  nice staff, but won't be returning for ramen.  Reasons for why I think the noodle was soba: - texture was more grainy (vs chewy) - color was more gray-ish (vs yellowish) - noodles were straighter (vs curly) - taste was more earthy (vs doughy)  Makes me doubt their other dishes 😔
I had an extraordinary time at this spot. We enjoyed the first-rate atmosphere and the meals. The waiters are very personal. I’m happy we ultimately managed to visit this place.
Fried Shrimps, delicious.
too salty

I like to go with friends to this place with my warmest recommendations. I visit this restaurant often. This recommendation is always successful. The meals are yummy and the crew is very friendly and cooperative. Every time  we visit this place we have a splendid evening.  highly recommended.
This spot obviously knows how to satisfy their clients. Regularly with a super nice mindset. The food is conveniently priced, constantly yummy and clean.

The sign says Sushi King, not Yamachan. And when you walk in, the counter says Pearl Lady. And then they have a separate sushi room that you are only allowed in if you are getting sushi. Their branding and space utilization is weird. That being said their ramen is good. The eggs are great. Their pork is good. The broth was a bit salty for my fiance and I. And I'm on a medicine that makes me crave salt

We come here regularly. We used to live in Japan and miss the food! I can really recommend the all you can eat sushi buffet here. This is a sit down restaurant, not self service. The takoyaki, ebi tempura, sushi and sashimi here are excellent. Everything is prepared freshly for you and very quickly. I also really love the shrimp tempura sushi rolls. The staff are very friendly, polite and helpful. Very clean.
I wanted to like this place but the ramen tasted like instant ramen. Fast service though.

Was looking for poke and sushi. Hm I found it. First I ordered bowl with two tuna and one salmon. She actually, started counting by hand each small cube of fish. I was given about 8 cubes finger picked. Do your self a favor and walk three more blocks to Poke DC and see the difference!  Sushi are cheap, that's correct, so I didn't lose a lot when I threw them I the trash. They use small pieces of belly and it tastes disgusting. And doesn't feel fresh.  Avoid at all costs!

My wife and I tried the volcano rolls, rockville rolls, avacodo roll, and the spicy tuna rolls.  All were excellent.  The rockville roll is a bit too sweet for myself or my wife, but that is more of a pallette thing for us, not a sign of a bad roll.
Awesome ramen
Food was pretty good.  Ramen would've been better if it was hot and not just warm.  The chicken wings and takoyaki tasted good and were a good size for the price.
Zero star if possible. This place is definitely running out of business. Had dinner here with wife at 7pm. Then suffered severe diarrhea until 3am. Sushi fish not fresh, some color has turned.

Went for the all-you-can-eat sushi on MLK day for lunch. The sushi wasnt the best quality which would have been fine for an all-you-can-eat place, but when we got the bill we discovered that we had been charged dinner prices. When we asked about this discrepancy, we were told there was no lunch menu because of the holiday. Would have appreciated some transparency with their pricing, it definitely was not worth the cost.
I liked the Ramen. Fast and good service.
I had the sushi all can the eat! The food and service was amazing! And the price is great!

Have you ever immediately regretted a last second decision you've made?  Have you ever taken the first bite of food and looked at your significant other with that look that says, "What in God's name have we done?" If you haven't, then I highly recommend this place.  Then you too can experience the awkward silence between you and your partner as you both try to mentally figure out exactly whose fault it is that you are eating such terrible food.  You too can frantically try to determine if you should dine and dash, pretend to have food poisoning, spit it out and claim contamination, or suffer through as much as you can possibly stand and then reluctantly pay the bill and run away as fast as your stubby little legs will carry you.  In short, this place is so gross it's disgrossting and will leave you questioning every decision you've ever made in life.  Then they'll tell you that they don't validate parking.
Got served with lukewarm ramen on a chilly day! This place used to be one of our favorite Sunday lunch place.

I was so excited about this place and it really disappointed. I went opening week after watching them build for MONTHS. I expected it to be a little shaky opening week. The setting was cute! The ramen itself was really okay. I got the bone broth. I've had much more flavorful ramen, and they had no eggs, but the packaging was top notch so I had fun. I got home from work and was sick with the worst food poisoning I think I've ever had, and the ramen was the only thing I had to eat that day (I skipped breakfast and walked over from work for lunch, hadn't eaten dinner yet), so it's my prime suspect. It wasn't a great experience and I think I'll find another ramen joint.

Note before I start: I had the tonkatsu soup.  The place is cozy enough. The indoor decor is honestly really good. Its very simplistic, and it doesnt bombard the eyes with needless information.  The bowls feel cheap. They give you one use only utensils. The trays are made of plastic, and I'm willing to bet the side dish plates are as well.  The soup actually tastes like its made from a powder. Something you would get out of an instant ramen or something. The color (at least for my soup) was a pale khaki. It was cloudy, and it almost looked like you could see the individual particles inside the soup. Not the most appetizing thing.  The noodles were good enough...i guess. Not something special, like a specialized noodle soup place, but not terrible.  I've never eaten chashu before, so I can't really speak about it, but it tasted like real pork, and it had flavor.  Overall, a cozy place good enough for the casual consumer, although if you're looking for authentic ramen, go somewhere else.  As a side note, the bubble tea right next door is pretty good. The value is also quite excellent. Highly recommend.

The staff was friendly and the place was very clean, but the ramen was just not that great compared to some other places I've been to on the pike (Temari and Akira) i also ordered chicken wings which looked very delicious in the picture they had posted on the screen at the cash register  but when the chicken came it was the size of a infants thumb, I've never seen chicken wings so small in my life.
Honestly the ramen really sucks here...tasteless...save your money and head over to akira or jinya...the tea place, pearl lady, that’s part of it/right next to it is awesome though

If you're not picky about ramen, and the location is convenient, it's decent. The shoyu broth was ok, but all other broth flavors were bland and such a let down. If you want better ramen for the price nearby, I recommend Akira instead.

The staff is really friendly and the place is clean.  However, the ramen is just not very good. Pretty bland and the cha shu just is not as I have come to expect from the other ramen places I've eaten at.

I was excited to try the ramen here and got the shoyu with shrimp tempura. While the interior is cute and modern, I found the ramen to be dissapointing and the seats too low except for the sofa seating which is at a comfortable height. I also tried the avocado salad which was fresh and dressed with a sweet eel sauce. The ramen broth was bland, and the toppings aside from the shrimp were less than memorable. They ask for a tip though it's all self-service and my table wasn't clean even after someone had made an attempt to wipe it off. Definitely going to other places for better ramen.
The noodles are not that great taste at all. There is that after taste of 鹼 in the noodles.

It's been a long time since I've been disappointed by any ramen place, and to say the least, I was disappointed with this experience.  Upon entering, the restaurant looks new, simple and clean and you expect it to be a sit down restaurant until you realize it is self service. Nothing wrong with that but it just didn't didn't vibe with the setting in my opinion.  I ordered ramen with tonkatsu broth and tonkatsu meat and my bf ordered the same tonkatsu broth (because they had ran out of chicken broth) with karage chicken. We also had ordered their Rockville roll as well. Food came out pretty fast but not what we were expecting at all. Soup fell flat in the flavor profile my BF's chicken felt like General Tso's chicken without the sauce. The egg was cooked great but had no color or flavor at all - looked like it was just dipped in soysauce. What was infuriating was that we were provided with a small-ass spoon that could barely be reached down to grab any broth.  We weren't that impressed with our sushi roll as well. It was a fried roll with salmon and cream cheese - all components of what I love in a roll - but I didn't even want to finish it after the second piece. There was nothing exciting about it. Also to note, there wasn't even wasabi or ginger in the box with it, just soy sauce.  It is mentioned in some reviews that the price was high for the quality of dishes and I definitely have to agree with that.  Perhaps switching over to resuable bowls and utensils can help cut costs and put it towards the quality of the food.  I hate to be so harsh about a new restaurant opening, but with so many other options to choose from, Yamachan needs to step up their game if they want to vie for more business.

This is my first time eating Raman soup not from the box and I was impressed. I got the chicken shoyu; it was flavorful and the fact that they give vegetables with all their soups is a plus. Will definitely go there again.

What kind of self serve restaurants asking for tips starting from 15%? This is what I hate most. Food is just okay. Not sure how long this new restaurant will last. Btw, the plastic spoon provided is so small. No green, no practical, no good.!

If you want Japanese ramen there are far better places to go in Rockville. Taste and quality are not up to my standards. The prices are too high for what you get. I also wasn't happy with the plastic disposable bowls and spoons, I would prefer to go to a place where I'm not contributing to plastic litter in the ocean.

The soup base for the ramen didn’t have much flavor and was pretty bland. For the price of 11.99 it’s a little bit expensive and would be better if it was around $8 or $9. There are better ramen places around here for a dollar or two more.
Hearty meal.
